alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma; Payne; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Oklahoma, Lincoln, southern Logan, southeastern Payne and northwestern Pottawatomie Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1059 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Cashion to 3 miles south of Meridian to near Agra to 4 miles south of Yale. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Edmond, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, Guthrie, Cushing, Chandler, Choctaw, The Village, Harrah, McLoud, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Perkins, Jones, Stroud, Nicoma Park, Yale, and Luther. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 122 and 158. Interstate 40 between mile markers 149 and 165. Interstate 44 between mile markers 125 and 182. Interstate 240 between mile markers 4 and 5, and between mile markers 15 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
